page.home: Bgee: gene expression data in animals

home.description-1: Bgee is a database for retrieval and comparison of gene expression patterns across multiple animal species.
home.description-2: It provides an intuitive answer to the question "where is a gene expressed?" and supports research in cancer and agriculture as well as evolutionary biology.
home.image-right: Images from Wikimedia Commons. In most cases, pictures corresponds to the sequenced strains.

top-anat.gene-list-details: {IDs} IDs provided, {UNIQUEs} unique genes found in {SPECIE}
top-anat.textarea-placeholder-gene-list: Enter a list of Ensembl identifiers, one ID per line, no quotes, no comma.

expression-comparison.title: Expression comparison
expression-comparison.description: Compare expression of several genes. If genes belong to several species, comparisons will be performed in homologous organs. Please enter one Ensembl ID per line.
expression-comparison.gene-list-placeholder: Enter a list of Ensembl IDs (one ID per line or separated by a comma)
expression-comparison.results-description: Results are ordered by default by descendant "Conservation score", then ascendant "Genes with absence of expression", then descendant "Max expression score". The order could be changed by clicking on one column, then press shift and click on another column.

genes.title: Gene search
genes.description: Search for genes based on Ensembl gene IDs, gene names, gene descriptions, synonyms and cross-references.

gene.name: Name
gene.source-anatomy-dev: Sources of annotation to anatomy and development:

anatomical-homology.title: Anatomical homology
anatomical-homology.description: Retrieve anatomical homologies from a list of species and a list of Uberon IDs. Retrieve Uberon IDs from organ names
anatomical-homology.species-common-ancestor-label: Species to define least common ancestor
anatomical-homology.least-common-ancestor: Least common ancestor of provided species

species.gene-expr-call-files-description: Bgee provides calls of presence/absence of expression. Each call corresponds to a unique combination of a gene, an anatomical entity, a life stage, a sex, and a strain, with reported presence or absence of expression. More information in our
species.anatomical-full: Anatomical entities, developmental stages, sexes and strains
species.processed-expr-value-files-description: Bgee provides annotations and experiment annotations, and processed expression values.

gene-exp-calls.title: Gene expression calls
gene-exp-calls.description-1: This page provides calls of baseline presence/absence of expression, and of differential over-/under-expression, either in single species, or made comparable between multiple species. Click on a species or a group of species to browse files available for download. It is possible to download these data directly into R using our
gene-exp-calls.description-3: . All data are available under the
gene-exp-calls.available-future-release: These files will be available in a future release.
gene-exp-calls.advanced-file-description: Advanced file includes information by data types.
gene-exp-calls.improvement-in-progress: Improvement of these files is in progress

processed-exp-values.title: Processed expression values
processed-exp-values.description-1: This page provides annotations and experiment information (e.g., annotations to anatomy, development, sex and strain, quality scores used in QCs, chip or library information), and processed expression values (e.g., read counts, TPM and FPKM values, log values of Affymetrix probeset normalized signal intensities). Click on a species to browse files available for download. It is possible to download these data directly into R using our
processed-exp-values.description-3: . All data are available under the
